title: Elton John reveals cruel jibe his mum made about husband that led to 7 year shun

Elton John has revealed the cruel jibe his mother made about his long-term partner that saw him stop speaking to her for seven years.

The music legend claimed his mum Sheila’s behaviour had become increasingly upsetting since he and David Furnish entered a civil partnership in 2005.

Her criticism of his life choices “amplified” with his mum full of bitterness and hatred for his work, his marriage and his life choices.

However, it was the departure of Elton’s long-term PA Bob Halley that led to the mother-son relationship taking a deeply sour turn.

(Image: WireImage)

Following an explosive row, Bob quit his job working for Elton, leaving Elton’s mum furious.

In his new autobiography, Elton revealed: “Mum was absolutely livid when she heard Bob had left — they'd always got on well.

“She didn't want to hear my version of events, and told me that Bob had been more of a son to her than I'd ever been.”

(Image: PA Archive/PA Images)

At that point, Sheila’s words turned poisonous and she aimed her anger at Elton’s husband David.

Seething, she cruelly said: “You care more about that f***ing thing you married than your own mother.”

The jibe was enough for Elton to break his relationship with her.

The pair did not speak again for seven years, although Elton continued to look after her financially.

(Image: Getty)

She was not invited when Elton and David turned their civil partnership into a formal marriage in 2014, which Elton described as “sad”.

He added: “But I got back in touch when I found out she was seriously ill, and sent her some photos of the kids.

“‘You've got your hands full,' was the only mention of them in her reply.

“I invited her to lunch. She walked into Woodside and the first thing she said was: 'I'd forgotten how small this place is.'

“I was determined not to rise to the bait. Instead, I asked if she wanted to see the kids, who were playing upstairs. She said no.”

He ended her visit by telling her he loved her.

Sheila replied: “I love you, too… But I don't like you at all.”
